column4: hey does anyone know how to setup vnc so it logs into its own session, rather then hijacking the current desktop session?
install a vnc server (vncserver, vnc4server or tightvncserver)
is that different from vino?
yes, vino only works for the existing desktop session
no, they use different ports.  vino uses 5900, *vnc*server uses 5901, 5902 ...
after i install a package (aka tightvncserver) how do i find out where it is?
yep, dpkg -L, or there is a file list in the package properties in synaptic
cool i got it working
great :)
err but its a blank x terminal without a regular terminal or an ubuntu desktop
ugh indeed.  That means that it isn't starting things up when the vnc session starts.
any suggestions?
maybe ill just stick to vino
I'm not sure although I can say that the vncserver package seemed to work straight away for me (in Dapper)
otherwise it's digging into the tightvncserver config, which I don't know much about sorry
could it because i've already got a vino session open?
i wouldn't think so, but give that a try (disable via Sys -> Prefs -> Remote Desktop)
but it appears to be defaulting to desktop 1 instead of 0
what is? vino?
no tightvncserver
yes, that's normal
well how do i get a terminal or a menu or something?
does right-click work
